title: Collaborative Distance Education Design: ADDIE Model-Based Satisfaction Improvement Project

context.prior_knowledge: Basic online learning experience and mobile device utilization skills
context.additional_context: Students access learning modules via personal mobile devices and must complete short weekly learning activities. Continuous feedback is provided through formative assessments

learning_goals: Learners can explain the remote instruction design process by applying the five stages of the ADDIE model (Analysis, Design, Development, Implementation, Evaluation).
Learners can produce three or more microlearning contents using collaborative design techniques that promote learner engagement.
Learners can design formative assessment tools optimized for mobile environments to achieve learner satisfaction of 80% or higher.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
